sub_title: Global Contractor Safety & Industry Safety Standards Manager at Shell
summary: An accomplished and highly successful Masters-qualified Global Logistics and Health & Safety Expert with a proven track record of success delivered over a 25-year career operating with the global Oil & Gas, Supply Chain, Manufacturing and Subsea-Construction sectors. Renowned as a trusted leader; able to empower and motivate multi-functional & diverse teams, to address operational issues and to resolve performance bottlenecks to consistently deliver on time and budget. Culturally astute, incisive and tenacious with a pragmatic style blending strategic vision with operational execution.

profile_positions.description: As Global Contractor Safety & Industry Safety Standards Manager, my principal focus encompassed implementing an improved, effective and common risk-based process – leveraging Industry Standards where possible - for the management of HSSE risks in a contract environment, so that both Shell and Contractor can dedicate appropriate resources to managing risk and delivering high HSSE performance.
profile_positions.title: Global Contractor Safety & Industry Safety Standards Manager

profile_positions.description:
As Global Head of Lifting Operations, my principal focus encompassed establishing technical capability and capacity for all the Upstream, Integrated Gas, Downstream, New Energies business units as well as their projects to guarantee safe and cost-effective lifting operations. I am currently leading a team of two direct reports, i.e., the Global Principal Technical Expert and a Sr. Lifting Engineer, with a further 60 FTE’s in a global network of Subject Matter Experts and I have oversight of the central team budget

Notable Accomplishments:
•	Reduced Health & Safety incidents by 12% YoY over the past five years by conducting assurance reviews and facilitating peer reviews against Shell’s safety requirements and Industry Standards, enabling safer lifting operations in the assets and projects
•	Boosted efficiencies and delivered cost savings of ~$75m by successfully replicating best practices and leveraging the use of new technologies and innovation, playing an integral role in the design and planning of these new processes
•	Incorporated into the above $75m achieved 15% cost savings directly related to contracting efforts by introducing competition to sites that were traditionally single-source, implementing competitive crane maintenance strategies and improved sparing strategies
profile_positions.title: Global Head of Lifting Operations

profile_positions.description:
I was seconded from Shell to join INPEX in Jakarta to establish their logistics functions and associated framework for their supply chain management. Furthermore, I led the ongoing operational logistics activity including project planning and providing operations phase logistics support for a large FLNG development (7.5mtpa) in a very remote part of Indonesia. I led a direct team of 6 FTE’s and had oversight of the planning phase, FTE’s and studies budget. 

Notable Accomplishments:
•	Successfully delivered key project milestones and received approvals from the Government and Regulator by i) presenting a systematic logistics approach, thus obtaining full implementation mandate ii) reviewing INPEX’s logistics activity and mapping to the new function iii) developing associated organisation and job descriptions
•	Delivered a flawless and efficient start-up of the project by i) developing a logistics strategy and managing studies for different phases and options for field development ii) consolidating logistics-related planning work previously conducted in different parts of the organisation iii) introducing/executing a structured planning approach based on Shell’s framework

•	Played an integral role in developing logistics strategies for emerging markets in the US, particularly Wind Energy and Oil Shale
